PhyMediumComments: black-and-white: Ansco Superpan Press safety film
CatDescriptText: C.C. Mosby, 643 Herron Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, January 18, 1958, pg. 2 with question: "Do you think that refuse drivers and collectors should be tipped at Christmas time? Is service affected if they are not?" answer reads: "I always give them tips.  If they give good service, they deserve everthing that they make and get."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of C.C. Mosby wearing eyeglasses, pencil moustache, and light colored barber's smock, standing with left hand on cash register that reads "Cash $5.00", posed in barbershop with two toned walls, furniture on the left with textured glass, several pair of scissors, hair brush, and certificate
